value.0: That enchantment I placed on the Irilium Crystals seems to have greatly weakened Janthos' golems. And just in time, too, judging by how all those Crimson Followers tried to turn them against us...
Janthos should never have created those monstrous constructs... Look at what has happened! Here we are, penned in by his own creations...
<< Activates "N_TALK_SWITCH" if "N_MODULE_STAGE" is 1. >>
<< Mod Stage 0, Talk Level 5 >>

I believe Janthos will be quite surprised when he learns of our friendly little sabotage. If he's mad at me, tell him I did it because I think he's cute, okay? And... And come visit me in the woods, someday, all right? I'm going to miss you all horribly.
I must leave. There is nothing I can do for Janthos now. I hope I'm wrong and that his golems don't pose the threat that I fear they might...
<StartAction>[Alia eyes your approach pensively.]</Start> Hi, <FirstName>...

Please give the crystals to Janthos. They should cause the golems to power down almost as soon as he has them installed. Thank you, <FirstName>! I'll feel a lot better making the journey home knowing that everyone here is a little safer from those monstrosities.
Have you found something for Janthos to use as a power supply?

Ah, Irilium Crystals. In the end, they're just stones like any other and I know a spell or two that should influence them. They won't destroy the golems but it should make them a little less dangerous at least. Are you really willing to do this for me?
If you say so, citizen <LastName>. If you've got something to do, then you had best go do it. I'll be fine right here, thank you very much...

<StartAction>[Alia takes the crystals into her hands, uttering words of magic over them. She sprinkles a bit of dust over them as well, causing the stones to cloud for a moment before returning to their natural color.]</Start> There, that should do it.
Have you discovered any news regarding Janthos' experiments?
What did Janthos tell you about his golems?

<StartAction>[Alia looks at you suspiciously but appears to let the matter drop.]</Start> If you say so, citizen <LastName>. If you've got something to do, then you had best go do it. I'll be fine right here, thank you very much...
City folk... Well I hope you're right in your assumption, citizen <LastName>, for it would be quite the shame if all of this crazy experimentation were to end in tragedy...

He's going to unleash a force that will be the death of him, I just know it! And I'll be far away in the woods where I can't watch over him. It's horrible, <FirstName>! If one of those things were to get out of control, I can't even imagine the consequences...
Irilium, you say? I fear I know what he has in mind. We need to stop this, <FirstName>. Janthos is putting himself and the city in danger. Will you help me?
I fear I know what he has in mind. We need to stop this, <FirstName>. Janthos is putting himself and the city in danger. Will you help me?
Later? What if there is no later? As soon as my parents are ready, we're heading back home. If we're going to do something, we need to do it now.

If you can bring me the material he intends to use as a power supply, maybe I can modify it to actually damage the golems enough to put them safely out of commission. Janthos will find other interests, safer interests. You know he will...
And don't you be, either, <FirstName>! I'm not going to let him out of my sight, even if Mom & Dad have to drag me home by the hair! You just see if I won't...
I know what I'm asking seems a bit extreme, <FirstName>, but Janthos refuses to listen to reason. Curiosity kills the cat, they say... I'll keep an eye on him until you get back.
Hiya, citizen <LastName>! <StartAction>[Alia's excited smile seems fit to split her face from ear to ear.]</Start>
You're as busy as your father, sometimes... Well... Safe journeys, citizen <LastName>.

They're unpacking the mules and crawling up the stairs to their inn room, last I checked. They're exhausted from the trip and from all of the emotion from the ceremony. I figured I'd let them sleep and take the time to say goodbye to you and Janthos.
But when I got here, Janthos wanted to show me the latest changes to his golem...

<StartAction>[Her mood turns instantly sour.]</Start> Janthos has found a way to make one of his stupid constructs speak. It's downright creepy, <FirstName>. Who knows how far these experiments will go?

He's going to unleash a force that will be the death of him, I just know it! And I'll be far away in the woods where I can't watch over him. It's horrible, <FirstName>! If one of those things were to get out of control, I can't even imagine the consequences...
City folk... Well I hope you're right in your assumption, citizen <LastName>, for it would be quite the shame if all of this crazy experimentation were to end in tragedy...
I feel like I've been cautioning him with every second word out of my mouth and what has it done? You know how he is. He's simply too taken with his experiments to pay heed to friendly advice.

I'll sit back and keep an eye on him. I chose the Redeemer crest, remember? If he hurts himself, at least I can patch him up now. In the meantime, if you could just speak with him and try to figure out what hare-brained plan he has up his sleeve next...
Thanks, <FirstName>. You're a good friend...

Oh, just stupid directions on how to get around the city at this point. I know it's harmless but... It speaks, <FirstName>. It thinks... What happens when it starts to speak and think for itself rather than for him?
Mock me all you like, <FirstName>, but I worry for him. The natural balance was not meant to be taken so lightly.
I thought you, being a <class>, would understand, <FirstName>. After all, Janthos is disturbing the balance of nature when he creates those monstrosities.
<< Activates "N_TALK_SWITCH" if "N_MODULE_STAGE" is 0. >>
<< This conversation node does nothing but reset the variable "N_TALK_SWITCH" >>
<< Set owner's journal quest to "JT_JANTHOS" >>
Not yet but I'll get to it as soon as I can.
Yes, I have some Irilium Crystals right here.
This is sabotage. I won't do it.
Of course. <StartAction>[Hand over the crystals.]</Start>
<StartAction>[Lie]</Start> We merely chatted about the weather.
Janthos knows what he's doing, Alia.
Why are you so worried about this?
He wants me to find some Irilium Crystals for him.
He says they need a power supply, still.
Maybe later, Alia.
I said later. I've got things to do.
All right, what do you have in mind?
What do you have in mind?
Don't be foolish, Alia!
I'll think about it.
Okay. If I find anything, I'll bring it to you.
Sorry, I don't have time for this right now.
Where are your parents?
Keeping an eye on Janthos?
You druids and your nonsense...
Janthos knows what he's doing, Alia.
I'm sure it will all be fine, Alia, but I have to go.
Any idea how we can stop him?
Maybe we can convince him to be more careful.
Maybe... But no promises, Alia.
Good idea. I'm on it.
All right, I'd better go.
What does his golem say?
If it were up to you, we'd still be living in trees!
